svcsubproc.title: Inspection Procedure for Lube Oil Contamination

step1.para: Check coolant level and oil level gauge to verify oil contamination complaint.

item.para: The presence of coolant in the oil will generally give the oil a white milky appearance.
If coolant in the oil is not verified, an oil sample can be taken for analysis.

step1.para: When oil contamination is verified, plug in cylinder block heater to warm coolant.

figure.caption: Air compressor isolated from engine for coolant leak test

step1.para: If engine is equipped with an air compressor, isolate compressor from the engine and test for coolant leak.

item.para: Remove the coolant inlet and outlet hoses for the air compressor cylinder head and remove the oil drain back line from the bottom of the air compressor mounting bracket.
Fill air compressor coolant passage and hoses with coolant.
Adapt air pressure fitting and regulator to one of the coolant hoses and block opposite hose.
Pressurize air compressor coolant hoses to 96 kPa (14 psi).
Inspect for coolant leakage from oil drain back line and listen for escaping air.
If leak is found, repair or replace air compressor. If no leak is found, proceed to next step.

step1.para: Remove glow plug harnesses, glow plugs and valve covers. Drain engine oil and remove oil filter.

item.para: Leave oil drain plug out of pan and oil filter cap off.

step1.para: Pressurize cooling system to 96 kPa (14 psi).
If coolant is leaking from oil pan, do the following.

item.para: Inspect entire cylinder head area for leaks at the cup plugs.
Inspect oil filter housing for coolant leaks from oil cooler.
If no leaks are found in above areas do step 9 to inspect for upper crankcase leakage.
If coolant system pressure is dropping and no coolant is leaking from oil pan, do step 7.

step1.para: Bar engine over by hand and check for coolant flooding the top of piston and flowing out of the glow plug bore.

item.para: If leaks are found, do step 8.
If leaks are not found, do step 9.

step1.para: Remove cylinder head from engine following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual. Perform all inspections and pressure test cylinder head to verify leak path. Inspect cylinder head gasket for damage at sealing areas which may have caused leak. Verify crankcase and cylinder head surface flatness using a straight edge and feeler gauge.

item.para: If glow plug or injector sleeve was replaced, retest cylinder head with pressure test plate to verify repair.

step1.para: Remove upper and lower oil pans following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: Verify 96 kPa (14 psi) pressure is maintained on radiator pressure tester.
If no leakage is found, do step 11.

step1.para: Remove oil cooler and oil filter housing from the engine following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual.
Do oil cooler pressure test following procedures in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: If a leak is found, replace oil cooler assembly.
If no leak is found, do step 13.

step1.para: Remove front cover and inspect gaskets and sealing surfaces following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual. Check front cover and crankcase with straight edge and feeler gauge.
Retest cooling system after any repair to confirm repair.
